Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; from top: part of lotus flower with added white and added red dot, and to its right part of white dot rosette; white zigzag band between white and red lines; part of possible lotus flower in white outline with traces of red centres; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of a structure: above, a horizontal line crossing two vertical lines; below, a block of chequer pattern probably indicating a stone construction, possibly an altar.
Curator's comments: The outlined rectangles might represent masonry made of larger stones than the chequer block structure below. On architectural elements on Grand Style Chian vases, see Lemos 1991, 104.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0802) (phase 2)
